benchmark_details.name: GraphPile
benchmark_details.overview: GraphPile is the first large-scale corpus specifically designed for continue-pretraining using Graph Problem Reasoning data, encompassing 10.9 billion tokens across 23 distinct graph tasks to enhance the reasoning capabilities of LLMs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enhance the reasoning capabilities of large language models (LLMs) by integrating graph problem reasoning data into their training.

data.source: Synthetic and real-world graph problems collected and generated through a systematic pipeline involving experts and LLMs.
data.annotation: Generated through a combination of programmatic approaches and human expert curation.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the number of correct responses divided by the total number of problems.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better reasoning performance of the model.
methodology.baseline_results: GraphMind models show improvements over baseline models, achieving significant accuracy gains in reasoning tasks.
methodology.validation: Models are validated across multiple reasoning tasks and datasets.
